:h[elp] keyword.fragment: Opens the help page for the specified keyword in Vim.

:sav[eas] file.fragment: Saves the current file with the specified file name.

:clo[se].fragment: Closes the current pane in Vim.

:ter[minal].fragment: Opens a terminal window within Vim.

K.fragment: Opens the man page for the word currently under the cursor.

h.fragment: Moves the cursor one character to the left.

j.fragment: Moves the cursor one line down.

k.fragment: Moves the cursor one line up.

l.fragment: Moves the cursor one character to the right.

gj.fragment: Moves the cursor down one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

gk.fragment: Moves the cursor up one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

H.fragment: Moves the cursor to the top of the screen.

M.fragment: Moves the cursor to the middle of the screen.

L.fragment: Moves the cursor to the bottom of the screen.

w.fragment: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word.

W.fragment: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

e.fragment: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word.

E.fragment: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

b.fragment: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word.

B.fragment: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

ge.fragment: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word.

gE.fragment: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

%.fragment: Moves the cursor to the matching character of a pair, such as parentheses, brackets, or braces. Use :h matchpairs in Vim for more information on supported pairs.

0.fragment: Moves the cursor to the very beginning of the current line.

^.fragment: Moves the cursor to the first non-blank character on the current line.

$.fragment: Moves the cursor to the end of the current line.

g_.fragment: Moves the cursor to the last non-blank character on the current line.

gg.fragment: Moves the cursor to the first line of the document.

G.fragment: Moves the cursor to the last line of the document.

5gg or 5G.fragment: Moves the cursor to line number 5 in the document.

gd.fragment: Moves the cursor to the local declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

gD.fragment: Moves the cursor to the global declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

fx.fragment: Moves the cursor to the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

tx.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position before the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

Fx.fragment: Moves the cursor to the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

Tx.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position after the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

;.fragment: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the same direction.

,.fragment: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the opposite direction.

}.fragment: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the next function or block.

{.fragment: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the previous function or block.

zz.fragment: Centers the cursor vertically on the screen.

zt.fragment: Positions the cursor at the top of the screen.

zb.fragment: Positions the cursor at the bottom of the screen.

Ctrl + e.fragment: Scrolls the screen down one line without moving the cursor.

Ctrl + y.fragment: Scrolls the screen up one line without moving the cursor.

Ctrl + b.fragment: Scrolls the screen up one page and moves the cursor to the last line of the new page.

Ctrl + f.fragment: Scrolls the screen down one page and moves the cursor to the first line of the new page.

Ctrl + d.fragment: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left while in insert mode.

Ctrl + u.fragment: Scrolls the screen up half a page and moves the cursor accordingly.

i.fragment: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text before the cursor position.

I.fragment: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the beginning of the current line.

a.fragment: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text after the cursor position.

A.fragment: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the end of the current line.

o.fragment: While in visual mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite end of the currently selected area.

O.fragment: While in visual block mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite corner of the selected block.

ea.fragment: Moves the cursor to the end of the current word and enters insert mode.

Ctrl + h.fragment: Deletes the character before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + w.fragment: Deletes the word before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + j.fragment: Inserts a line break at the current cursor position while in insert mode.

Ctrl + t.fragment: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right while in insert mode.

Ctrl + n.fragment: Inserts the next matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + p.fragment: Inserts the previous matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

Ctrl + rx.fragment: Inserts the contents of register 'x' at the cursor position.

Ctrl + ox.fragment: Temporarily switches to normal mode from insert mode to execute a single normal mode command 'x'. After executing the command, it returns to insert mode.

r.fragment: Replaces the character under the cursor with the next character typed.

R.fragment: Enters replace mode, allowing you to replace multiple characters until the ESC key is pressed.

J.fragment: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line, adding a single space in between.

gJ.fragment: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line without adding any space.

gwip.fragment: Reflows the current paragraph, adjusting line breaks to fit within the current window width.

g~.fragment: Switches the case of characters (uppercase to lowercase or vice versa) from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion.

gu.fragment: Changes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion to lowercase.

gU.fragment: Changes text to uppercase up to the specified motion.

cc.fragment: Replaces the content of the entire current line.

c$ or C.fragment: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current line.

ciw.fragment: Replaces the entire word under the cursor.

cw or ce.fragment: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current word.

s.fragment: Deletes the character under the cursor and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cl).

S.fragment: Deletes the entire line and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cc).

xp.fragment: Transposes the character under the cursor with the character to its right (effectively deleting and pasting).

u.fragment: In visual mode, changes the selected text to lowercase.

U.fragment: In visual mode, changes the selected text to uppercase.

v.fragment: Starts visual mode, allowing you to select text by moving the cursor. Once text is selected, you can perform various commands on it (like yanking/copying).

V.fragment: Starts linewise visual mode, which allows you to select entire lines by moving the cursor.

Ctrl + v.fragment: Starts visual block mode, allowing you to select a rectangular block of text.

aw.fragment: In visual mode, selects the current word.

ab.fragment: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by parentheses ().

aB.fragment: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by curly braces {}.

at.fragment: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

ib.fragment: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing parentheses ().

iB.fragment: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing curly braces {}.

it.fragment: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

>.fragment: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the right.

<.fragment: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the left.

y.fragment: In visual mode, copies (yanks) the selected text into the clipboard.

d.fragment: In visual mode, deletes the selected text.

~.fragment: In visual mode, switches the case (uppercase/lowercase) of the selected text.

:reg[isters].fragment: Displays the contents of all registers.

\"xy.fragment: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the specified register x.

\"xp.fragment: Pastes the contents of the specified register x.

\"+y.fragment: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the system clipboard.

\"+p.fragment: Pastes the contents of the system clipboard.

:marks.fragment: Displays a list of all saved marks.

ma.fragment: Sets the current cursor position as mark A. You can use any letter for the mark name.

`a.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position marked as A.

y`a.fragment: Copies (yanks) the selected text and places it at the position marked as A.

`0.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position where Vim was last exited.

'\".fragment: Moves the cursor to the position when you last edited this file.

`.`.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position of the last change in this file.

``.fragment: Moves the cursor to the position before the last jump.

:ju[mps].fragment: Displays a list of all recent jumps.

Ctrl + i.fragment: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the jump list.

Ctrl + o.fragment: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the jump list.

:changes.fragment: Displays a list of all recent changes made in the buffer.

g,.fragment: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the change list.

g;.fragment: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the change list.

Ctrl + ].fragment: Jumps to the definition of the tag under the cursor.

qa.fragment: Starts recording a macro and saves it in register 'a'.

@a.fragment: Executes the macro stored in register 'a'.

yy.fragment: Copies the current line into the default register (").

2yy.fragment: Copies the current line and the next line into the default register (").

yw.fragment: Copies the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word into the default register (").

yiw.fragment: Copies the word under the cursor into the default register (").

yaw.fragment: Copies the word under the cursor and the space after or before it into the default register (").

y$ or Y.fragment: Copies the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line into the default register (").

p.fragment: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor.

P.fragment: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor.

gp.fragment: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

gP.fragment: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

dd.fragment: Deletes the current line and places it in the default register (").

2dd.fragment: Deletes the current line and the next line and places them in the default register (").

dw.fragment: Deletes the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word and places them in the default register (").

diw.fragment: Deletes the word under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

daw.fragment: Deletes the word under the cursor and the space after or before it and places it in the default register (").

d$ or D.fragment: Deletes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line and places them in the default register (").

x.fragment: Deletes the character under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

>>.fragment: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right.

<<.fragment: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left.

>%.fragment: Indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

<%.fragment: De-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

>ib.fragment: Indents the inner block enclosed by parentheses ().

>at.fragment: Indents a block enclosed by angle brackets <> (tags).

3==.fragment: Re-indents the current line and the two lines below it.

=%.fragment: Re-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

=iB.fragment: Re-indents the inner block enclosed by curly brackets {}.

gg=G.fragment: Re-indents the entire buffer (all lines in the current file).

]p.fragment: Pastes the contents of the default register (") and adjusts the indentation to match the current line.

:w.fragment: Saves the current file without exiting Vim.

:w !sudo tee %.fragment: Saves the current file using sudo (superuser privileges). This is useful when you don't have write permissions to the file.

:wq or :x or ZZ.fragment: Saves the current file and exits Vim.

:q.fragment: Exits Vim. Fails if there are unsaved changes.

:q! or ZQ.fragment: Exits Vim and discards any unsaved changes.

:wqa.fragment: Saves all open files and exits Vim.

/pattern.fragment: Searches forward for the specified pattern.

?pattern.fragment: Searches backward for the specified pattern.

\\vpattern.fragment: Searches for the specified pattern using 'very magic' mode, where non-alphanumeric characters are interpreted as special regex symbols without escaping.

n.fragment: Repeats the last search in the same direction (forward).

N.fragment: Repeats the last search in the opposite direction (backward).

:%s/old/new/g.fragment: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file.

:%s/old/new/gc.fragment: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file, prompting for confirmation before each replacement.

:noh[lsearch].fragment: Removes the highlighting of search matches.

:vim[grep] /pattern/ {`{file}`}.fragment: Searches for a given pattern in multiple files.

:cn[ext].fragment: Jumps to the next match from a previous search.

:cp[revious].fragment: Jumps to the previous match from a previous search.

:cope[n].fragment: Opens a window that displays a list of matches from the previous search.

:ccl[ose].fragment: Closes the quickfix window, which contains the list of search results.

:tabnew or :tabnew {page.words.file}.fragment: Opens a new tab, optionally with a specified file.

Ctrl + wT.fragment: Moves the currently active split window into its own new tab.

#gt.fragment: Moves to the tab specified by the number #.

:tabm[ove] #.fragment: Moves the current tab to the position specified by the number # (indexed from 0).

:tabc[lose].fragment: Closes the current tab and all its associated windows.

:tabo[nly].fragment: Closes all tabs except the currently active tab.

:tabdo command.fragment: Runs the specified command on all open tabs.

:e[dit] file.fragment: Opens a specified file for editing in a new buffer.

:bd[elete].fragment: Deletes a specified buffer, which effectively closes the associated file.

:b[uffer]#.fragment: Switches to the buffer identified by its index number.

:b[uffer] file.fragment: Switches to the buffer associated with the specified file name.

:ls or :buffers.fragment: Displays a list of all currently open buffers.

:sp[lit] file.fragment: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window horizontally to display it.

:vs[plit] file.fragment: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window vertically to display it.

:vert[ical] ba[ll].fragment: Arranges all open buffers as vertical windows.

:tab ba[ll].fragment: Opens all open buffers in separate tabs.

Ctrl + ws.fragment: Splits the current window horizontally, creating a new split.

Ctrl + wv.fragment: Splits the current window vertically, creating a new split.

Ctrl + ww.fragment: Switches the focus to the next window within the current split arrangement.

Ctrl + wq.fragment: Closes the currently active window within a split arrangement.

Ctrl + wx.fragment: Exchanges the position of the current window with the next one in the split arrangement.

Ctrl + w=.fragment: Resizes all windows in the current split arrangement to have equal height and width.

Ctrl + wh.fragment: Moves the cursor to the window located to the left in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wl.fragment: Moves the cursor to the window located to the right in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wj.fragment: Moves the cursor to the window located below in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wk.fragment: Moves the cursor to the window located above in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wH.fragment: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the leftmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wL.fragment: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the rightmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

Ctrl + wJ.fragment: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the bottommost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

Ctrl + wK.fragment: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the topmost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

zf.fragment: Manually defines a code fold from the current cursor position up to the specified motion.

zd.fragment: Deletes the code fold located under the cursor.

za.fragment: Toggles the open/closed state of the code fold located under the cursor.

zo.fragment: Opens (expands) the code fold located under the cursor.

zc.fragment: Closes (collapses) the code fold located under the cursor.

zr.fragment: Reduces the folding level by one, effectively opening folds at the outermost level.

zm.fragment: Increases the folding level by one, effectively closing folds at the current level.

zi.fragment: Toggles the folding functionality on or off.

]c.fragment: Jumps to the start of the next change in the document.

[c.fragment: Jumps to the start of the previous change in the document.

do or :diffg[et].fragment: Obtains (gets) the difference from another buffer and applies it to the current buffer.

dp or :diffpu[t].fragment: Puts (applies) the difference from the current buffer to another buffer.

:diffthis.fragment: Marks the current window as part of the diff comparison.

:dif[fupdate].fragment: Updates the displayed differences between buffers in diff mode.

:diffo[ff].fragment: Disables diff mode for the current window.
